title: 114_hr2939
content: The "Enforce Existing Gun Laws Act" may repeal certain appropriations riders that limit the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives' ability to administer federal firearms laws. The Enforce Existing Gun Laws Act aims to repeal restrictions on the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives related to firearms acquisition records and physical inventory checks by firearms dealers. It also mandates the destruction of instant check records within 24 hours. The Enforce Existing Gun Laws Act mandates the destruction of instant check records within 24 hours and repeals restrictions on the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives related to firearms acquisition records. Amendments are made to the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2012 regarding limitations on firearms trace data. The 6th proviso under the heading "Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives--Salaries and Expenses" in the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2010 and the Omnibus Appropriations Act, 2009 is amended to specify the fiscal year as 2010 and 2009 respectively. The 6th proviso under the heading "Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives--Salaries and Expenses" in various Appropriations Acts is amended to specify fiscal years 2008, 2009, and 2010. The 6th proviso under the heading in title I of division B of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2005 is amended. Section 644 of division J of the Consolidated Appropriations Resolution, 2003 is repealed. Prohibition on drawing broad conclusions about firearms-related crime using firearms trace data is repealed. The provisions related to firearms regulations in various Appropriations Acts are repealed, including restrictions on importation of surplus military firearms and denial of federal firearms license due to lack of business activity. The provision related to salaries and expenses in the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2013 is amended by removing the 6th proviso.
